wikipedia_page.main: Regan Evans Charles-Cook (born 14 February 1997) is a footballer who plays for Scottish Premiership club Ross County. Born in England, Charles-Cook represents the Grenada national team.

link_mentions.page: Charlton Athletic F.C. Under-23s and Academy

response: He is the older brother of fellow professional footballers Reice Charles-Cook and Regan Charles-Cook. Cook's uncle, James, is a former British super middleweight boxing champion.

response: He is the brother of fellow professional footballers Anthony Cook and Regan Charles-Cook. His uncle, James, is a former British super middleweight boxing champion.

Following his loan spell at Partick, Blair returned to Dingwall in January. From then and until the end of the season, he only made 5 appearances. Coming into the 2021-22 campaign, Blair has become a first-team regular. And following the departure of Ross County legend Michael Gardyne to Highland rivals Inverness Caledonian Thistle, Blair was given the number 7 to wear on his back. A number that, if you ask a life-long Ross County fan, leaves quite a big pair of boots to fill. Due to COVID-19 complications, Ross County were unable to play any of their League Cup group stage games, so the attention for Blair turned to the Premiership. Since then however, Blair has scored 4 goals since his return to Dingwall. He bagged a brace in a 2-2 draw at home to Hearts, his third came from a 2-3 defeat at home to St. Mirren, and his fourth from a 1-0 home win against Hibernian. At a time where the club were in much need of points. He is currently the second highest top scorer at the club behind Regan Charles-Cook with 5 goals at the time.

On 16 June 2017, Exeter City were drawn at home to Charlton Athletic in the first round of the EFL Cup. Lee Holmes opened the scoring for the Grecians after 54 minutes by netting a free kick. However, goals by Billy Clarke and Regan Charles-Cook saw the Reds eliminated in the First Round for the first time since 2014.
